title: Governor-General of Australia
summary: The governor-general of Australia is the representative of the monarch, currently Queen Elizabeth II, in Australia.[3][4] The governor-general is appointed by the monarch on the recommendation of government ministers.[5] The governor-general has formal presidency over the Federal Executive Council and is commander-in-chief of the Australian Defence Force. The functions of the governor-general include appointing ministers, judges, and ambassadors; giving royal assent to legislation passed by parliament; issuing writs for election; and bestowing Australian honours.[6]
